title: Chelsea’s N’Golo Kante reveals he wanted Marseille transfer
text:
N’Golo Kante considered joining Marseille over Leicester (Picture: Getty) Chelsea star N’Golo Kante has revealed he was tempted to join Marseille over Leicester City in a transfer that would’ve drastically altered the course of Premier League history.
£50m Prem star perfect for back three decides on summer move to Chelsea The Frenchman has arguably been player of the season in each of his two years in England so far, playing a major role in the Foxes’ shock title victory last term.
Kante’s form for Leicester led to a £32million switch to Chelsea last summer, and the reigning champions have slumped back to being relegation candidates without him.
Kante won the title with Leicester and looks set to do the same with Chelsea (Picture: Getty) Still, the 25-year-old admits he almost didn’t opt for the move to the King Power Stadium as he was also keen on the opportunity to play for Marseille.

‘Among the clubs that most wanted to recruit me were Marseille and Leicester,’ Kante told Canal Plus.
‘I thought I had to go through a stage in France. I remember the generation of (Mamadou) Niang, (Franck) Ribery and (Samir) Nasri and it was a team that I liked, especially in the Champions League.’
